TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SecurityCallContext extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Describes the chain of callers leading up to the current method call.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.SecurityCallContext> class to interrogate the security context of calls to the methods of a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> class.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/CPP/employeeinformation.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[EnterpriseServices_Security#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/CS/employeeinformation.cs#4)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/VB/employeeinformation.vb#4)]

Docs.summary: Gets a object that describes the caller.
Docs.value: The object that describes the caller.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.SecurityCallContext.Callers%2A> accesses the `Callers` item in the `ISecurityCallContext` collection in COM+.

Docs.summary: Gets a object that describes the security call context.
Docs.value: The object that describes the security call context.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The static <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.SecurityCallContext.CurrentCall%2A> property is the recommended way to access the security call context.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this method to obtain a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.SecurityCallContext> object describing the security context of a method call.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/CPP/employeeinformation.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[EnterpriseServices_Security#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/CS/employeeinformation.cs#6)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/VB/employeeinformation.vb#6)]

Docs.summary: Gets a object that describes the direct caller of this method.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this method to check the identity of the direct caller of a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> method.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#7](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/CPP/employeeinformation.cpp#7)] [!code-csharp[EnterpriseServices_Security#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/CS/employeeinformation.cs#7)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/VB/employeeinformation.vb#7)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool IsCallerInRole(string role) cil managed

Docs.summary: Verifies that the direct caller is a member of the specified role.
Docs.returns: if the direct caller is a member of the specified role; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this method to determine if the caller of a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> method is in a specified role.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/CPP/employeeinformation.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[EnterpriseServices_Security#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/CS/employeeinformation.cs#6)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/EnterpriseServices_Security/VB/employeeinformation.vb#6)]

Docs.summary: Determines whether security checks are enabled in the current context.
Docs.value: if security checks are enabled in the current context; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsUserInRole (string user, string role);
.method public hidebysig instance bool IsUserInRole(string user, string role) cil managed

Docs.summary: Verifies that the specified user is in the specified role.
Docs.returns: if the specified user is a member of the specified role; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets the value from the collection in COM+.
Docs.value: The value from the collection in COM+.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.SecurityCallContext.MinAuthenticationLevel%2A> is the least secure authentication level of all callers in the chain.

Docs.summary: Gets the value from the collection in COM+.
Docs.value: The value from the collection in COM+.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.SecurityCallContext.NumCallers%2A> is the number of callers in the chain of calls.

Docs.summary: Gets a that describes the original caller.
